title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Monday 2 October 2017 - BBC News
summary: student found with 'knife on school grounds ' .
sus package found at sw church .
woman , 86 , dies from car crash injuries .
kit to reverse effects of drugs overdose may have saved 10 lives .
row over slurry pit on devon-cornwall border .
truro city gets away draw in the next round of fa cup qualifiers .

documents.title: our live coverage
text: that 's all for today from local live , but we 'll be back at 08:00 to bring you all tuesday 's news , sport , travel and weather updates .
do n't forget bbc spotlight with justin leigh and victoria graham at 18:30 on bbc one and the late news at 22:30 .

documents.title: police officers fly to british virgin islands to aid hurricane aftermath
text: eight officers from devon and cornwall police have flown to the british virgin islands to support the local force in the aftermath of hurricane irma , which devastated the islands and killed at least five people .
in total , 54 officers from forces around the uk , will carry out joint patrols of the islands and assist in policing duties .

ch con andy marsh from the national police chiefs ' council for international policing , said : once again officers from across the country have volunteered to help those in need , knowing the desolation and limited resources in the british virgin islands .
we have provided support to the local police in maintaining law and order .
we will continue to work closely with the british virgin islands police force to help return these islands to some normality . ''
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: overdose kits praised by former drug addict
text: a former drug addict says kits being handed out to reverse the effects of a drugs overdose could have saved the lives of many people he knew .
the kits contain naloxone , which is injected into the leg , and are thought to have saved at least 10 lives in devon since february .

former addict jim said : `` the people i personally have known who have died from overdoses goes way into three figures and had naloxone been available back then , a large proportion of them would probably still be alive now and maybe have had the change to turn their lives round , like i have . ''

documents.title: mud , mud , glorious mud !
text: more than 2,000 women got `` down and dirty '' for a very good cause in plymouth yesterday .
they were taking part in the pretty muddy obstacle run in central park to help raise funds for cancer research uk .
the charity said all the sponsorship money would be used to fund life-saving research .
describing the atmosphere during the 5km ( three mile ) race as `` electric '' , events manager amy salmon thanked all the participants and their supporters .
the atmosphere on the day was full of emotion , courage , tears and laughter as thousands of like-minded ladies came together to unite in the fight against cancer .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: closure of truro age uk day centre confirmed
text: a day centre for the elderly in truro will close , it 's been confirmed .
the decision follows a review by age uk .
nigel clark , the charity 's people and estates director , has confirmed the future of its other centres in cornwall will be reviewed .
`` if a venue is n't appropriate we wo n't use it and if it is , we 'll look at how we can develop it , '' he said .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: police raid houses across plymouth in major operation
text: police have raided homes across the city in a major operation linked to the supply of drugs .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: muckspreading smell 'unacceptable '
text: a row 's growing over the scale of muckspreading on the devon-cornwall border at hartland .
resident jeremy roe says the muck is `` not the smell of the countryside '' and the amount , taken from a slurry pit at beckland farm , is reaching almost `` industrial '' proportions .
`` the smell is foul - to the extent that one does n't go outside and the smell penetrates the home and you ca n't open a window , '' he said .
`` this is not the smell of the countryside - what we 're talking about is something profoundly different . ''
the owner of the pit , which does not have planning permission , has applied for retrospective approval .
author: BBC Inside Out

documents.title: teign valley road closed for emergency repairs after partially collapsed embankment
text: essential stabilisation work will take place on a road through south devon after an embankment partially collapsed .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: east to hold on to sunny skies
text: a dry and bright start to tuesday , but it will turn increasingly cloudier from the west through the day , with eastern areas perhaps holding on to sunny skies for the longest .
winds will remain light but it will feel cool , with a maximum temperature of 15c ( 59f ) .
author: David Braine
Weather Forecaster

documents.title: police lift road cordons after reports of sus device
text: a police incident closed much of the centre of redruth earlier , after reports were made of a sus device being found in the grounds of the methodist church in wesley street .
local cordons were put in place .
a 20-year-old man from redruth has been arrested and taken into police custody in connection with the incident .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: tower blocks residents 'reassured ' after false fire alarm response
text: people living in a tower block in devonport say they feel reassured after a mass evacuation of the building yesterday when the fire alarms went off .
dozens of firefighters were sent to tamar house to deal with what turned out to be a false alarm .
devon and somerset fire and rescue service said it was pleased with its response .
resident gosha zadovska said : `` i 'm glad it was nothing dangerous , but [ the alarms ] work and now i feel safe . ''
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: man taken to hospital after crash
text: a man in his 70s was taken to derriford hospital this morning with a head injury after a collision with a van near callington .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: sus device in church grounds : number of roads remain closed in redruth
text: a police incident is ongoing in redruth after reports of a sus device being found in the grounds of the methodist church in wesley street .
there 's a heavy police presence in the town centre - with several roads currently cordoned off .
local cordons have been put in place .
station road , fore street , alma place and green lane are closed due to the incident .
a 20-year-old man from redruth has been arrested and taken into police custody .
a police incident is ongoing in the centre of redruth after reports a sus device was found in a church yard
the girl comes into view last second like : `` notice meeeee ! ! ! ''
lol !
think she 's the one walking backwards as camera pans across the street .
excellent effort on her part .
girl : i 'm gon na do it boy : do n't do it girl : i'mma gon na do it !

documents.title: nhs accused of 'culling sick ' in dialysis transport row
text: the nhs in cornwall has been accused of cullling the sick '' after drawing up plans to stop funding transport for dialysis patients .
author: The Daily Telegraph

documents.title: breakingman arrested after reports of sus device in church grounds
text: a man has been arrested by police in connection with an ongoing incident in redruth .
police officers are at the methodist church on wesley street following reports of a sus device being found in the church grounds .
cordons have been put in place whilst the explosive ordinance device team assess the scene .
a 20-year-old man from redruth has been arrested and taken into police custody .
officers said the incident was not believed to be related to terrorism .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: breakingstudent with knife on school grounds
text: a student took a knife on to school premises today , it has emerged .
devon and cornwall police said they were made aware of a pupil bringing in a knife to penair school in truro at about 13:50 .
the school had alerted all parents this afternoon to inform them of `` an incident '' .
staff have since seized the knife .
police said no threats were made at the school .
on 27 september , a 14-year-old boy was stabbed outside trelander and st clement community hall in the same area of truro as the school .
police said they were not aware of any connection between the two incidents .
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: pirates must 'up ante ' , says cattle
text: cornish pirates boss gavin cattle says his squad will have to up their work rate in training in order to end a run of poor results .
a 28-26 defeat at yorkshire carnegie was their fourth in five games .
`` the disappointing thing is that we 're doing stuff in training and it 's breaking down under pressure , '' cattle told bbc radio cornwall .

`` we 've got to go through the mill in training now , it 's all very well being fresh for the weekend , but if we 're breaking down in certain components that we 're repeating we 've got to up that ante in training . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: residents object to asphalt plant
text: launceston residents have slammed plans for a new asphalt plant over concerns that dangerous toxins could harm children at nearby schools .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: breakingincident at penair school in truro
text: a student was acting `` in a threatening way '' at penair school in truro earlier today , the school said .
a spokesman for the school said the student was `` isolated '' and taken off the school premises .
no students or staff are understood to have been injured during the incident .
all of the parents of pupils at the school received a text message from the school to inform them of an incident .
devon and cornwall police have not yet responded to a request for further information .
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: breakingsus package at church
text: there are reports of a `` sus device '' in the grounds of the methodist church on wesley street in redruth , cornwall .
the explosive ordnance device team and police are on the scene and cordons have been put in place .
there will be more on this story as we get it .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: hospital team in world record rowing challenge
text: a physiotherapist from the royal devon and exeter hospital is hoping to break not one but two world records by rowing more than 3,000 nautical miles across the atlantic ocean .
rosalind west - along with three other exeter women - will aim to become the fastest female crew and fastest female four to cross the world 's second largest ocean .
the team is raising awareness for environmental pressure group surfers against sewage on the impact of plastics on our oceans , beaches and wildlife .
the quartet will need to raise £ 80,000 for an ocean-going rowing boat and equipment to get to the start line of the talisker whisky atlantic challenge in december .
author: Hayley Westcott
Broadcast Journalist

documents.title: delays on south western railway services
text: national rail enquiries says `` a passenger exiting the train before it reached a station at wimbledon combined with an earlier points problem affecting platforms 7 -11 at london waterloo is causing disruption across the south western railway network '' .

documents.title: cheers ! newton abbot wins cider accolade
text: a pub in newton abbot has been named as the best place in the uk to drink real cider .
it 's the second time ye olde cider bar has been awarded the accolade by the campaign for real ale .
it 's a hard life !
my afternoon at @ twitterid award-winning @ twitterid in newton abbot all for @ twitterid
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: torquay and truro city get away fa cup draws
text: torquay united and truro city have both got away draws in the fa cup fourth qualifying round .
truro face a trip to hampton and richmond borough on 14 october , seven days after they host them in national league south .
it is the furthest the club has ever got in the cup .
torquay travel to fellow national league side aldershot town looking for their first fa cup win in six years .
the gulls have yet to win a game this season while the shots are eighth in the national league .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: biggest mass stranding of portuguese man-of-war
text: an unprecedented number of the potentially deadly portuguese man-of-war has washed ashore in cornwall .
the marine conservation society says in just three weeks 2,002 of the jellyfish-like creatures have been found .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: travel update for devon : broken-down coach on haldon hill
text: travel update for devon : broken-down coach on haldon hill
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: more than £ 100m invested in cornwall - creating almost 1,000 jobs
text: more than £ 100m is being invested in cornwall by a developer , creating almost 1,000 jobs at three of the county 's biggest retail projects .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: steamship group announces £ 30,000 community fund
text: the isles of scilly steamship group has announced the return of its popular community fund with up to £ 30,000 available to support local projects and good causes on the isles of scilly and across cornwall .
author: Falmouth Packet

documents.title: truro city eye historic fa cup run
text: truro city are aiming for a first ever fa cup first round appearance , says striker cody cooke .
the cornwall-based club progressed to the final qualifying round for the first time in their history after a 4-1 win over afc sudbury on saturday .
having gone a goal down , chris todd levelled just before half-time , before second-half goals from aaron lamont , tyler harvey and stewart yetton .
`` who 's to say we ca n't go further now ? ''
cooke told bbc radio cornwall .
`` as a local boy it means a lot to the people of cornwall .
`` we 've never gone this far and the boys were joking around a little bit asking how we have n't gone this far , because it 's only two wins , but it 's never happened . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: swanpool beach swimmer , 80 , dies
text: an 80-year-old man , who was pulled from the sea unconscious on sunday afternoon , has died .
a member of the public raised the alarm after the man , who is from falmouth and swims regularly in the sea , got into difficulty at swanpool beach .
paramedics performed cpr and he was airlifted to the royal cornwall hospital in truro by a coastguard helicopter , where he later died .
devon and cornwall police said the death is not being treated as sus and a file is being prepared for the cornwall coroner .
author: Amy Gladwell
BBC News Online

documents.title: plea to 'keep dogs close ' after mushroom poisoning
text: dog walkers are being urged to keep their animals close - and possibly muzzled - after one dog died and two became seriously ill after eating wild fungi on woodbury common .
janet wallace , an environment health officer at east devon district council said : `` we 'd encourage people to be just a little bit more vigilant and keep their dogs closer to them . ''
mushrooms collected by a field mycologist at woodbury common .
a council is warning some fungi are poisonous to dogs .
more @ twitterid
and humans !
author: Clare Woodling
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: man in custody after attempt to grab child at devon holiday park
text: a manhunt was launched in devon after a man attacked a young girl at a holiday park .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: mineshaft fall man to raise funds for rescuers
text: a man who was rescued after falling 50ft ( 15m ) down a disused mineshaft in cornwall last week has set up an online fundraising page to buy specialist mine rescue equipment for the team which saved him .
andrew williams was rescued after a six-hour operation , involving more than 50 personnel from the emergency services .

some members of cornwall rescue group , who returned to the shaft at port nanven , near st just , to retrieve andrew william 's rucksack , were re-united with him yesterday at plymouth 's derriford hospital .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: weather update for devon and cornwall : umbrellas at the ready !
text: cloud amounts will increase during the afternoon as rain arrives from the west , turning heavy in places .
feeling cool , especially in the wind , with a maximum temperature of 16c ( 61f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: dogs poisoned by woodbury common fungi
text: one dog has died and two others have been seriously ill after being poisoned by mushrooms at woodbury common .
it 's thought the dogs ate the fly agaric fungi , which grows rapidly in september and october .
royston hooking 's dog summer died , despite appearing to recover after being treated by a vet .
`` next day she was violently sick and by the time we got her back to the vet , she was really ill and by 9.30 in the evening , she had died , '' he said .
east devon district council is urging dog walkers to be vigilant and muzzled if their pets are prone to things up .
author: Clare Woodling
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: hunt for dog lost at sea when fishing boat capsized , killing crewman
text: a heartbroken family who lost a fisherman when he died after a boat capsized have issue a desperate plea to find the dog that was onboard .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: rise in shark numbers off cornwall
text: shark fishermen say they 're catching hundreds more of the fish around cornwall than in previous years .
one fisherman in looe said in 2015 about 700 sharks were caught , rising to 1,700 last year .
dave bond said the most predominant species off cornwall is the blue shark .
anglers are now being asked to tag their sharks for scientific research before they 're returned to the sea .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: travel update for cornwall : collision blocks a388
text: # cornwall a388 between callington and st mellion blocked both directions by a collision involving cyclist - long queues of traffic [ pl ]
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: chicken factory suspends operations
text: one of the largest suppliers of chicken to uk supermarkets has suspended operations after an investigation allegedly revealed a string of health and safety breaches .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: woman , 86 , dies from car crash injuries
text: an elderly woman involved in a single-vehicle crash in plymouth last week has died from her injuries .
emergency services were called to the accident in royal navy avenue on thursday .
the 86-year-old , who was a passenger in the silver vauxhall corsa when it hit a wall , was taken to derriford hospital but died the following day .
devon and cornwall police have appealed to anyone who saw the accident to contact them .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online

documents.title: tide times for devon and cornwall
text: if you 're thinking about taking a trip to the seaside today , here are the times of high water around the region 's coastline .
there will be a full forecast in spotlight 's lunchtime news at 13:30 on bbc one .
author: Dan Downs, Weather Forecaster

documents.title: mushroom warning after dogs poisoned
text: poisonous mushrooms are thought to have killed a dog and made two others seriously ill .
in all three instances , the dogs had been walking on woodbury common .
east devon district council has issued a warning to dog walkers and is recommending that owners of dogs who are prone to things up , should consider muzzling their pets .
fly agaric mushrooms , which are found in september and october , can sprout quickly .
author: Clare Woodling
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: travel update for cornwall : crash in penzance
text: # cornwall on the a30 at penzance - reports of a 3 vehicle collision around treweath road .
[ pl ]
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: travel update for devon : gas mains work in paignton
text: travel update for devon : gas mains work in paignton
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: tumble dryer caused flat fire
text: a tumble dryer fire has gutted a flat in st austell .
four crews were sent to the building in fore street , bugle on sunday , cornwall fire and rescue service said .
the fire started on the first floor of a three-storey house and spread to a neighbouring property , they added .
western power were called after flames burnt through an electrical cable and a red cross emergency response vehicle was also sent `` to provide support '' to the people living there .
author: Amy Gladwell
BBC News Online

documents.title: travel update for cornwall : accident in st columb major
text: travel update for cornwall : accident in st columb major
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: weather for devon and cornwall : cool and breezy
text: a bright and breezy start to the day for all before cloud amounts increase during the afternoon as rain arrives from the west , turning heavy in places .
a cool feel to the day , especially in the wind with a maximum temperature of 16c ( 61f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: addicts given overdose reverse kits
text: special kits are being given out to more drug addicts in devon , to help stop them overdosing .
they contain the medication naloxone , which is injected into the leg and reverses the effect of an overdose .
it 's thought at least 10 lives in devon have been saved since the programme started in february .
the drug has been used in plymouth since 2016 and drugs workers are also being given kits .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: residents ' anger over muckspreading
text: north devon district council is being asked to retrospectively approve a huge slurry pit at beckland farm near hartland .
the owner of the pit is promising to cover it , but one local objector says the smell of muck taken from the pit and spread on fields is unacceptable .
it has also been claimed the volume of much being sprayed is affecting some people 's health .
author: BBC Inside Out

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for monday
text: good morning and welcome to another week with bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall today .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Lynne French
BBC News Online
